result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel William Villa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $150.00 has been applied.  The remaining Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:32 AM: Attorney Todd Allen Snow in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Snow:  Valid DL has been obtained.  Court is willing to proceed via Atty Authorization.  DA states recommendation is joint for Costs only.  Plea tendered: NC FTI IID.    Court receives NC plea entered by Counsel thru Atty Authorization.  JOC entered.  No allocution offered.  The Court imposes Court Costs only - $150 cash bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA surcharge ordered - no sample ordered.  Atty Snow to review and file appeal rights within the next week or so.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-26-2016 10:30 am

Case Called @ 3:26 PM: Defendant Joel William Villa in court with attorney Todd Allen Snow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Snow:  Requesting add'l time on P/S to be able to maintain current employment as a Realtor.  Requesting add'l time on sentencing until after the 1st of the year.  Def would then be eligible for reinstatement of DL.  No objection by the State.  The Court:  Case to be placed in suspended status pending P/S.  Def reminded that bond conditions remain in effect.  P/S rescheduled - NOH Given.  Counsel advised that with authorization on file, defense counsel could appear via telephone.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
